page.title: 11Farms and Ecology: Hunton
page.content: Eight farmers keep{sheep}as well as cattle. Favoured breeds are Scottish Blackface crossed with Teeswater, half bred Masham and Suffolk. Mainly they are bred for fat lambs. Some wool goes to Halifax mills. A few Jacob's sheep are kept.{Spring and winter barley}for animal feed is grown on 3 farms, roots on another. At Ayrlow Banks they grow {wheat and oilseed rape.}Scrogg Farm is entirely arable. Artichokes are one of the crops grown to attract gamebirds. Constable Burton Hall guests shoot on the land. Cote House rears turkeys for Christmas markets. We discovered only one pig and a small number of poultry for farmers own use. During our{Y.O.C. walks along country lanes or newly signposted{footpaths }over the fields, we see plenty of wild life. Roe deer, kingfishers, wayside flowers or foxes are favourites here.Our{elms are dead.
